src:
Venezolanos Peralta y Sánchez ganadores del Guante de Oro
04 Nov 2019, 13:22 by Agencias

El segunda base de los Medias Blancas de Chicago Yolmer Sánchez y el jardinero David Peralta de los Diamondbacks de Arizona conformaron el cuadro de ganadores latinos del Guante de Oro de la MLB




Houston.- Los nombres de los mejores defensores en cada posición de las Grandes Ligas fueron dados a conocer este domingo con la entrega de los Guantes de Oro y cuatro peloteros latinoamericanos estuvieron entre los galardonados.
El campo corto puertorriqueño Francisco Lindor, de los Indios de Cleveland, encabezó la lista de los cuatro peloteros latinoamericanos.
Junto a Lindor, que ganó el premio por segunda vez, su compatriota y compañero, el receptor Roberto Pérez lo recibió por primera vez.
Lo mismo que sucedió con el segunda base venezolano Yolmer Sánchez, de los Medias Blancas de Chicago, todos ellos jugadores de equipos que militan en la Liga Americana.
Mientras que en la Nacional el único ganador latino fue el jardinero izquierdo, el venezolano David Peralta, de los Diamondbacks de Arizona.
En la Liga Americana, destaca la presencia Lindor con su segundo Guante de Oro, mientras que Pérez lo recibió por primera vez, lo mismo que Sánchez, los tres en la Americana, y Peralta en la Nacional.
El hispano Nolan Arenado, tercera base de los Rockies de Colorado, ganó su séptimo Guante de Oro que lo dejó al frente de la lista de los galardonados.
Estos son los ganadores del Guante de Oro 2019:

- Receptor

Ganador Liga Americana: Roberto Pérez, Cleveland.
Finalistas: Danny Jansen, Azulejos, Christian Vázquez, Medias Rojas.
Ganador Liga Nacional: J.T. Realmuto, Filadelfia.
Finalistas: Austin Hedges, San Diego; Yadier Molina, San Luis.

- Primera base

Ganador Liga Americana: Matt Olson, Oakland
Finalistas: Yuli Gurriel, Houston; Justin Smoak, Toronto
Ganador Liga Nacional: Anthony Rizzo, Chicago
Finalistas: Christian Walker, Arizona; Paul Goldschmidt, San Luis

- Segunda base

Ganador Liga Americana: Yolmer Sánchez, Chicago Medias Blancas
Finalistas: José Altuve, Houston; DJ LeMahieu, Nueva York
Ganador Liga Nacional: Kolten Wong, San Luis
Finalistas: Ozzie Albies, Atlanta; Adam Frazier, Pittsburgh

- Campo corto

Ganador Liga Americana: Francisco Lindor, Cleveland
Finalistas: Marcus Semien, Oakland; Andrelton Simmons, Los Angeles Angelinos
Ganador Liga Nacional: Nick Ahmed, Arizona
Finalistas: Paul DeJong, San Luis; Trevor Story, Colorado

- Tercera base

Ganador Liga Americana: Matt Chapman, Oakland
Finalistas: Alex Bregman, Houston; David Fletcher, Los Angelinos de Los Angeles
Ganador Liga Nacional: Nolan Arenado, Colorado
Finalistas: Anthony Rendon, Washingon; Josh Donaldson, Atlanta

- Jardinero Izquierdo

Ganador Liga Americana: Alex Gordon, Kansas City
Finalistas: Robbie Grossman, Oakland; Andrew Benintendi, Boston
Ganador Liga Nacional: David Peralta, Arizona
Finalitas: Juan Soto, Washington; Hunter Renfroe, San Diego

- Jardinero Central

Ganador Liga Americana: Kevin Kiermaier, Tampa Bay
Finalistas: Mike Trout, Los Angelinos de Los Angeles; Jackie Bradley Jr., Boston
Ganador Liga Nacional: Lorenzo Cain, Milwaukee
Finalistas: Victor Robles, Washington; Harrison Bader, San Luis

- Jardinero derecho

Ganador Liga Americana: Mookie Betts, Boston
Finalistas: Kole Calhoun, Los Angelinos de Los Angeles; Josh Reddick, Houston
Ganador Liga Nacional: Cody Bellinger, Los Angeles Dodgers
Finalistas: Bryce Harper, Filadelfia; Jason Heyward, Chicago Cachorros

- Lanzador

Ganador Liga Americana: Mike Leake, Seattle
Finalistas: José Berríos, Minnesota; Lucas Giolito, Chicago Medias Blancas
Ganador Liga Nacional: Zack Greinke, Arizona
Finalistas: Jack Flaherty, San Luis; Aaron Nola, Filadelfia.

text:
Venezuelans Peralta and Sánchez winners of the Golden Glove
04 Nov 2019, 13:22 by Agencies

Chicago White Sox second baseman Yolmer Sánchez and gardener David Peralta of the Arizona Diamondbacks made up the Latin winners' box of the MLB Gold Glove




Houston.- The names of the best defenders in each major league position were announced on Sunday with the delivery of the Golden Gloves and four Latin American players were among the winners.
Puerto Rican shortstop Francisco Lindor, of the Cleveland Indians, topped the list of the four Latin American players.
Together with Lindor, who won the award for the second time, his compatriot and partner, receiver Roberto Pérez received it for the first time.
The same thing happened with Venezuelan second baseman Yolmer Sánchez, of the Chicago White Sox, all of them team players who militate in the American League.
While in the National the only Latin winner was the left fielder, the Venezuelan David Peralta, of the Arizona Diamondbacks.
In the American League, Lindor stands out with his second Golden Glove, while Pérez received him for the first time, as did Sánchez, the three in the American, and Peralta in the National.
The Hispanic Nolan Arenado, third baseman of the Colorado Rockies, won his seventh Golden Glove that left him at the top of the list of winners.
These are the winners of the Golden Glove 2019:

- Receiver

American League winner: Roberto Pérez, Cleveland.
Finalists: Danny Jansen, Azulejos, Christian Vázquez, Red Sox.
National League Winner: J.T. Realmuto, Philadelphia.
Finalists: Austin Hedges, San Diego; Yadier Molina, San Luis.

- First base

American League Winner: Matt Olson, Oakland
Finalists: Yuli Gurriel, Houston; Justin Smoak, Toronto
National League Winner: Anthony Rizzo, Chicago
Finalists: Christian Walker, Arizona; Paul Goldschmidt, St. Louis

- Second base

American League Winner: Yolmer Sánchez, Chicago White Sox
Finalists: José Altuve, Houston; DJ LeMahieu, New York
National League Winner: Kolten Wong, St. Louis
Finalists: Ozzie Albies, Atlanta; Adam Frazier, Pittsburgh

- Short field

Winner American League: Francisco Lindor, Cleveland
Finalists: Marcus Semien, Oakland; Andrelton Simmons, Los Angeles Angels
National League Winner: Nick Ahmed, Arizona
Finalists: Paul DeJong, San Luis; Trevor Story, Colorado

- Third base

American League Winner: Matt Chapman, Oakland
Finalists: Alex Bregman, Houston; David Fletcher, Los Angeles Angels
National League Winner: Nolan Arenado, Colorado
Finalists: Anthony Rendon, Washingon; Josh Donaldson, Atlanta

- Left gardener

American League Winner: Alex Gordon, Kansas City
Finalists: Robbie Grossman, Oakland; Andrew Benintendi, Boston
National League Winner: David Peralta, Arizona
Finalitas: Juan Soto, Washington; Hunter Renfroe, San Diego

- Central Gardener

American League winner: Kevin Kiermaier, Tampa Bay
Finalists: Mike Trout, Los Angeles Angels; Jackie Bradley Jr., Boston
National League Winner: Lorenzo Cain, Milwaukee
Finalists: Victor Robles, Washington; Harrison Bader, St. Louis

- Right fielder

American League Winner: Mookie Betts, Boston
Finalists: Kole Calhoun, Los Angeles Angels; Josh Reddick, Houston
National League Winner: Cody Bellinger, Los Angeles Dodgers
Finalists: Bryce Harper, Philadelphia; Jason Heyward, Chicago Cubs

- Launcher

American League Winner: Mike Leake, Seattle
Finalists: José Berríos, Minnesota; Lucas Giolito, Chicago White Sox
National League Winner: Zack Greinke, Arizona
Finalists: Jack Flaherty, San Luis; Aaron Nola, Philadelphia.
